member.name: T:UnityEngine.ClusterInputType
member.summary: Values to determine the type of input value to be expect from one entry of .

summary.para: Interface for reading and writing inputs in a Unity Cluster.

ClusterInput provides access to VRPN devices by connecting to a VRPN server. It also provides access to writeable inputs. All inputs managed by ClusterInput will be replicated to the rest of the connected slaves in the cluster. Using ClusterInput is much like using the traditional Input system in Unity.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.ClusterInputType.Button
member.summary: Device that return a binary result of pressed or not pressed.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.ClusterInputType.Axis
member.summary: Device is an analog axis that provides continuous value represented by a float.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.ClusterInputType.Tracker
member.summary: Device that provide position and orientation values.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.ClusterInput.AddInput(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,UnityEngine.ClusterInputType)

summary.para: Add a new VRPN input entry.

The parameters are identical to how you add a input via “Project Setting > Cluster Input”. Input entry added via this method only valid for the lifetime of the application session. The added entry will not persist like those you added via the “Project Setting > Cluster Input”.

member.param: Name of the input entry. This has to be unique.
Device name registered to VRPN server.
Index of the Input entry, refer to vrpn.cfg if unsure.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.ClusterInput.CheckConnectionToServer(System.String)
member.summary: Check the connection status of the device to the VRPN server it connected to.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.ClusterInput.EditInput(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,UnityEngine.ClusterInputType)

summary.para: Edit an input entry which added via .
This function is not able to edit persistent input entry defined at “Project Setting > Cluster Input”.

member.param: Name of the input entry. This has to be unique.
Device name registered to VRPN server.
Index of the Input entry, refer to vrpn.cfg if unsure.
Type of the ClusterInputType as follow.

summary.para: Returns the axis value as a continous float.
The range depends on configuration of VRPN server.
Returns the binary value of a button.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.ClusterInput.GetTrackerPosition(System.String)
member.summary: Return the position of a tracker as a Vector3.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.ClusterInput.GetTrackerRotation(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the rotation of a tracker as a Quaternion.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.ClusterInput.SetAxis(System.String,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the axis value for this input. Only works for input typed Custom.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.ClusterInput.SetButton(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the button value for this input. Only works for input typed Custom.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.ClusterInput.SetTrackerPosition(System.String,UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Sets the tracker position for this input. Only works for input typed Custom.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.ClusterInput.SetTrackerRotation(System.String,UnityEngine.Quaternion)
member.summary: Sets the tracker rotation for this input. Only works for input typed Custom.
